item.title: Recruitment Advisor
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Program Overview:

Australia is providing support to the Royal Papua New Guinea Constabulary (RPNGC) in accordance with direction from the Australian Government. PNG-APP Phase IV is the deployment of 50 AFP sworn and support staff into Papua New Guinea. These personnel work as Advisors at urban and district level police stations of the RPNGC) in Port Moresby (POM) and Lae, augmenting the previous PNG-APP mission of 17 personnel. PNG-APP personnel also work as inline advisors to the RPNGC Office of Reform. This assistance is an important element in the shared goals of the Government of Australia (GoA) and the Government of Papua New Guinea (GoPNG).

The RPNGC is the national police force with a staffing level of approximately 5200 officers posted around the country. Its mandate is to preserve peace and good order and impartially enforce the law in partnership with the community. Policing in the nation is high on the Government agenda and RPNGC is tasked by GoPNG with managing a very significant program of expansion over the medium term. These reforms are managed and coordinated by the Assistant Commissioner of Police (ACP) Office of Reform.

PNG-APP is seeking to identify advisors with the relevant qualifications and experience to support RPNGC in core areas that support operational policing. The objective of the roles is to work, at all times, with counterparts to build their skills and competencies, and the capabilities of the division, to do the job the RPNGC expects of them.

Objectives of the role:

The recruitment advisor will work closely with the Assistant Commissioner Police, Human Resources, the RPNGC recruitment team and members of the PNG-APP to design, implement and manage RPNGC talent acquisition for base level recruits in accord with the recommendations of the recent review.

Utilising experience and knowledge the advisor will help develop, shape and deliver an appropriate ‘new solution’. They will work with the RPNGC recruitment team and other stakeholders, building strong relationships and partnering with them through the recruitment rebuilding process to:

  • Improve the population of RPNGC talent pools;
  • Better screen and manage the police recruit selection process;
  • Using appropriate recruitment and selection methodologies and tools and outsourcing agreed elements of the selection process;
  • Supporting and educating RPNGC personnel in recruitment better practices and procedures;
  • Monitoring and reporting on operational performance and compliance, capturing relevant data and ensuring stakeholders and management receive timely updates.

Qualifications and Skills:

  • A tertiary degree in a relevant field
  • Work experience in the PNG public service or similar developing country environment

General Professional Experience:

  • Ability to advise on strategic planning, results based management and reporting
  • Ability to lead recruitment, contracts management, performance appraisal, career development management, build teams, maintain high staff morale
  • Strong IT skills
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively with others to build productive coalitions and contribute to sustainable outcomes, including advocacy and the capacity to negotiate effective solutions
  • High level interpersonal skills including verbal and written communication skills and an exceptional ability to develop and maintain results-focused stakeholder relationships.
  • Ability to implement new systems (business side) and affect staff behavioural/ attitudinal change

Specific Professional Experience:

  • Demonstrated experience in change management and in mentoring counterparts and senior managers through organizational change.
  • Able to partner closely with counterparts and be viewed as a trusted adviser providing strategic business advice enabling solutions whilst also managing the operational aspects of the work being performed.
  • Knowledge of, or the ability to quickly acquire knowledge of, the provincial approach to government across PNG and in particular, the autonomy arrangements of Bougainville, and the law and justice issues that impact on Bougainville.

If you are interested in the position and your expertise/experience matches the terms of reference please email your CV with a brief covering email to Sarah_Owen@dai.com

Results to be achieved by the project are:

  • analysis of regulatory framework for mediation (including the Civil Procedural Code(s) and, if needed, drafted amendments of the Mediation Act adopted by the Parliament Assembly of BiH, Official Gazette BH 37/04, and other relevant regulation in order to achieve an optimal implementation of the European Union Directive on Certain Aspects of Mediation in Civil and Commercial Matters 2008/52/EC),
  • analysis of regulatory framework for court based mediation, and, if needed, drafted new Alternative Dispute Resolution Act in Judicial Matters, aimed at establishing multi-door court house model,
  • analysis of other relevant regulations for ADR (court settlement, arbitration)
  • analysis of code of conduct for mediators, set of policy recommendations, action plan for further political and operational support for the development of mediation in Bosnia and Herzegovina.

Senior Legal Expert (Cat.I)

S/he combines both technical competence and practical experience in the field of applying and improving ADR.

Qualifications and skills:

Master degree in an area of law or any other appropriate discipline for this assignment or equivalent professional experience of 4 years above the general professional experience demanded below.

General professional experience

Not less than 12 years general professional experience relevant for the assignment.

Specific professional experience:

  • Must have practical experience in the field ADR including mediation,
  • Legal practice would be considered an advantage,
  • Experience assessing and/or designing policies in the field of ADR/mediation,
  • Experience of developing mediation in a transition country would be considered an advantage.

Language skills

  • Excellent command of written and verbal English language.
  • Knowledge of local languages would be considered an advantage. If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Adeline_VanHoutte@dai.com

item.title: Programme Design Specialist
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The initiative will aim to design and deliver business support service networks in Cook Islands, Fiji, Papua New Guinea, Samoa, Solomon Islands, Tonga and/or Vanuatu. It is anticipated that the activity may be piloted in a sub-set of three to four of these countries initially, with a view to expanding more widely to other countries once established and if successful. The overall goal of this initiative is to increase the growth and prosperity of PIC small to medium enterprises (SMEs) while developing the market for sustainable, commercial business support services.

The initiative will build on previous and existing support programmes and is expected to be completed in two phases. Phase one includes the design of the initiative based on an MFAT concept note, desktop research and consultation with regional and PIC stakeholders. Timing is an important consideration, as it is expected that the design phase will be completed by June 2015.

Phase Two includes the implementation of the initiative. While the scope of services delivered under Phase Two will be determined during Phase One, it is anticipated to include the following tasks: establishment of business support service hubs in selected PICs; establishment and coordination of linkages with regional and in-country business support service providers; development of local capability to expand or maintain support networks and services, and; short-term delivery of business support services as required.

DAI is submitting an Expression of Interest for this project and is looking to identify a Programme Design Specialist to nominate in their bid:

Required:

  • Knowledge and practical experience of designing/implementing sector policy support programmes in private sector development;
  • Knowledge and practical experience of conducting trade & business sector analysis and assessment, with particular reference to policy, coordination, institutional setting and capacity, and performance monitoring;
  • In-depth and recent understanding of the private sector in the Pacific would be an advantage;
  • Previous experience of working with MFAT would be a strong asset;
  • Fluency in spoken and written English, and excellent writing skills.

Key qualifications and experience:

  • Advanced University degree (master’s degree or equivalent) in a relevant field;
  • Minimum 10 years’ experience of programme design for developing countries, and relating to the development of SMEs;
  • Extensive experience of donor coordination, incorporating recent experience of aid effectiveness, harmonisation and alignment issues in programme design;
  • Previous experience of working in the Pacific is required;
  • Excellent inter-personal and communication skills in English language is essential;
  • Computer literacy and public presentation and advocacy skills.

If you meet the criteria and would like to be considered for this nominated role please email your CV with a covering note outlining how you fit the requirements. Please email your application to sarah_owen@dai.com quoting Business Support Service in the subject line of your email.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

item.title: Team Leader, Law & Justice Sector, Papua New Guinea
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The Team Leader will manage and support a team of technical and operational staff to deliver a highly complex and important DFAT investment to support law and justice in Papua New Guinea. The program will build on Australian support to the sector from the Papua New Guinea-Australia Law and Justice Partnership, which was completed in June 2014 and its ensuing Transition Program, which runs from July 2014 to December 2015.

The program will target agencies along with sub-national institutions and stakeholders in Hela, Southern Highlands, Gulf, Western, Oro and Morobe provinces, plus the Autonomous Region of Bougainville (ARB).

The Team Leader will establish and manage relationships with both potential and identified stakeholders, and will facilitate and coordinate collaboration with other development programs being implemented by DFAT and other donors.

Length of the project: 2016 - 2019 Start Date: August 2015 (to support the mobilisation and transition phase)

Qualifications and Skills:

  • A tertiary degree in a relevant field (international development, international law etc);
  • An experienced leader of complex technical advisory programs in developing country contexts;
  • First class interpersonal skills and an ability to rapidly develop strong relationships in a cross-cultural environment. Professional Experience:
  • Experience in implementing governance programs in decentralised service delivery contexts;
  • Highly familiar with working with law and justice agencies and community justice initiatives;
  • Ability to mainstream gender-sensitive programming and anti-corruption initiatives within program design and implementation;
  • Able to demonstrate an outstanding performance history with the Australian Aid Program;
  • Prior experience in Papua New Guinea is desirable.

How to apply: Please send your CV by email to Sarah_Owen@dai.com. Please note that due to high volumes of applications, we cannot guarantee to respond to each applicant.
